summary: This document is an internal FBI email chain from September 30, 2019, forwarding a complaint from an individual who identifies as an Epstein/Maxwell/Wexner victim who first reported in 1996. The victim expresses frustration at being ignored since 2006 and demands answers and therapy for the FBI's treatment of them.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: An FBI agent who is forwarded the victim's complaint email for awareness.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named by the victim as one of the perpetrators of abuse.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named by the victim alongside Epstein and Wexner.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Named by the victim alongside Epstein and Maxwell.

connections.description: Both are named together by the victim as perpetrators.
Both are named together by the victim, implying a connection in the abuse context.
Both are named together by the victim alongside Epstein.

events.title: Victim's initial report
events.description: The victim states they first reported everything about Epstein, Maxwell, and Wexner in 1996.

events.title: Victim's second interview
events.description: The victim mentions a second interview in 2006, after which they felt ignored.

events.title: Victim complaint email to FBI
events.description: The victim sends a complaint to the FBI's EpsteinVictimList mailbox, expressing distress over being ignored and demanding therapy and answers.

keyFacts: A victim identifies themselves as having reported abuse involving Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and Leslie Wexner as early as 1996.
The victim claims to have been ignored by the FBI since their second interview in 2006.
The victim demands therapy to deal with the FBI's treatment of them, equating it to the trauma from Epstein's abuse.
The communication is an internal FBI email chain from September 2019, showing the complaint was forwarded for awareness and potential follow-up.
